paragraphs: Abraham Lincoln to Simeon Francis, 9 June 1848
General TAYLORhas received the nomination of the Convention for President of the U.[United] States.

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln telegraphedSimeon Francisfrom the Whig National Convention, which had nominated Zachary Taylor as theWhig Party’s candidate in the1848 presidential election.  This is the first known instance of Lincoln employing the telegraph.Marilyn Mueller, “Tapping into the New Technology: Lincoln’s Earliest Telegraphic
